alert.note: Alert for Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 23 at 3:43PM PST until February 24 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 expected. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Santa Clarita Valley. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Advisory, until midnight PST tonight. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. Extended exposure to cold can cause hypothermia for animals and people. Vehicle windshields will be frosted.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
